Not every therapist is well matched to a patient and you donâ€™t know how many people they have come across, therapists start somewhere. Some therapists handle certain mental difficulties in different ways. Also not every therapist has dealt with every mental illness they treat. Itâ€™s not a personal jab to the original therapist.

Mental health is too important to stick with someone if you donâ€™t feel they are able to help you on your journey. You and I donâ€™t know the therapist or the depths of what OP is dealing with or their sessions. Also this has nothing to do with love and hate. Itâ€™s literally about what ends up being best for OP based on OPs thoughts of the whether there is still trust and itâ€™s helpful enough to stick through.

Thank you for this

I know this happened an hour again and I hope youâ€™re in an okay place. Everyone has mentioned what you need to be doing in the future but for right now...

Breathe. Deep inhale. Long exhale. Repeat.

I canâ€™t imagine the crushing heartbreaking feeling but I do know that what happened isnâ€™t a reflection on  your worth as a person. It doesnâ€™t mean you arenâ€™t enough, it means that she wanted something different. She did something extremely selfish and thatâ€™s on her. 

Itâ€™s okay to be upset and itâ€™s okay to not want to see her right away. You will work out the details of every little thing later. For right now, be with a good friend and do something that makes you happy or gives you some peace. See if you can stay somewhere else tonight, get some of your things while sheâ€™s out of the house and take the time to gather your thoughts and let yourself have some relief from this situation. 

If you donâ€™t have a therapist or someone you can confide in in addition, it may be worth looking for to help you heal, but for right now, take your time. Nothing needs to happen right this second. Your heart and mental health are the most important things right now so please take care of them. 

You have my support and a giant virtual hug and I know you can get through this.

Are you on a medication that could make you feel more neutral? Iâ€™ve noticed depending on what anxiety meds Iâ€™m on, it can make me feel zombie like. If not, you may need something to give energy levels a little boost. I hope this helps!

I feel like thatâ€™s the sort of thing people who have never experienced anxiety say. Panic attacks are something that happen to you but you can learn to control them. I would say if your therapist is giving you a bad vibe now, it might be best to find a new one. This is about your journey and overcoming your anxiety so keep with doing whatâ€™s best for you!
I definitely needed to hear this! Thanks OP!

Itâ€™s totally okay if you need medication type assistance to get you back to where you want to be. It can be for a short time or a long term kind of solution. You can work with a doctor to try a natural supplement or you can try antidepressants. 

If you want to go the non medical route and itâ€™s something you feel you can do, try and get sunlight or exercise. Both will raise your spirits a little at a time and make you feel happier. 

If you need to build confidence to help battle the anxiety of circumstances being out of your control, work on raising your self esteem so that you trust that you can handle any situation that gets thrown at you. I personally have used â€œ10 Days to Self Esteemâ€ and it helps reframe thoughts as well as includes an anxiety checklist quiz so you can track your progress. 

Itâ€™s not something thatâ€™s going to change overnight, itâ€™s going to be a process but Iâ€™m sure you already know that. Donâ€™t beat yourself up either, anxiety happens and it doesnâ€™t make you a broken person to have it. You can manage it and have a more fulfilled life and make sure that it NEVER runs your life again. You got this! Youâ€™re the boss of your mind and body!
Iâ€™ll give that a shot, thank you for the suggestion! Thatâ€™s definitely affordable!
Iâ€™m screenshoting that so hopefully Iâ€™ll remember lol Stay in touch if you ever need it! Good luck with your journey!

Yea, youâ€™re right. I think last night was my wake up call. I hadnâ€™t thought about therapy again, Iâ€™ve been in before and maybe just routinely need it until I can get all my thoughts in check. Thanks for the advice! Iâ€™ll see out a new therapist. If you have any tips for finding a new one lmk? I will try and I can do this! :)

Itâ€™s relieving to know Iâ€™m not the only one doing and feeling like this although I hope youâ€™re able to find your peace with it too! I feel like Iâ€™m scared to be happy like once I think it and let it happen itâ€™ll all get taken away. I appreciate the affirmations and encouragement, I really needed to hear all this. I need to give them to myself way more hopefully itâ€™ll overwrite my bad thoughts. I wish you the same! I donâ€™t think you have anything to feel ashamed or worried about if you decide to bring this up in therapy. Thatâ€™s why their there to support and guide you through it. Itâ€™s a tough thing to admit even to yourself but I think Iâ€™m finally tired of being my own problem and I know he deserves an emotionally strong partner because life is tough.

My favorite books are: 
The Princess Bride by William Goldman - really a must read 
The Picture of Dorian Gray - Oscar Wilde 
The Hitchikers Guide! 
Howls Moving Castle - Diana Wynn Jones - I actually named my dog after the character Howl in the book and I can practically quote it to you ğŸ˜‚

Good Omens - Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman! Super fun read if you enjoyed the banter of Hitchhikers Guide.  

If youâ€™re wanting to start discworld, I personally started with â€œMortâ€ because the character of Death was super interesting but my partner has read like every Discworld Novel and loves Terry Pratchett and says, 

â€œSo my favorite ones are already into the series but the start of the Citywatch series is â€œGuards Guardsâ€, start of the Death series is â€œMortâ€, the very first book is â€œColor of Magicâ€. A good stand alone book is â€œThief of Timeâ€, it has recurring characters but you donâ€™t need to know who they are to follow along. 

The best ones are the ones with Moist Von Lipwig, his first one is â€œGoing Postalâ€ (also a film) and doesnâ€™t need prior knowledge but helps with Vetinariâ€™s character (deep character who has the most books in the series - basically heâ€™s in most of them)

You could always start with watching Going Postal the film and decide if you like it. Watching the â€œHogfatherâ€ (the second Death book) can get you into Deaths character. Both films are 2-3 hours long. Shortest book in the series is â€œEricâ€ by Terry Pratchett and is a Death Novel.â€


Death is my favorite Discworld character but Moist is also great!
Born a Crime by Trevor Noah is about his life in South Africa growing up. Itâ€™s fascinating, funny and eye opening.

I really liked Adulting by Kelly Williams Brown, it was nice listening to someone who had their shit together or at least as much as adulty adults can. Tbh, no one knows what the hell is going on but it gets easier to not stress out about it. Graduating college was the most free Iâ€™ve ever felt so hang in there! 

10 Steps to Self Esteem is a workbook that helps reframe thinking and has a Depression and Anxiety evaluation you can take. 

Get your Shit together by Sarah Knight was enjoyable and made me feel like like a mess. 

You are a badass by Jen Sincero was encouraging. It can be nice having a cheerleader on your side. 

The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People May help with time management if you need it. 

The Life Changing Magic of Tidying Up by Marie Kondo helped me let go of things that didnâ€™t serve me - emotionally and literally. 

I hope some of this helps. I have been out of college like 3 years and everything has balanced out for me now but I had a major breakdown before I graduated. You can DM me if youâ€™d like to chat. 

Best of Luck! You got this!

The Princess Bride.

We just recently got our Aussie puppy but we have 4 cats, any advice on getting them to have positive interactions?

Iâ€™m also a first time Aussie owner and itâ€™s a tough first few weeks. I personally had the puppy blues which had me spiraling and it didnâ€™t help the adjustment for me. If you have this as well, itâ€™s actually fairly common. 

My boy will be 14 weeks tomorrow and it does get easier, I think mainly because it takes time to learn your pup and for them to learn you. 

This is what itâ€™s been like: 
I got him at 10 weeks old. I was lucky because he slept through the night already when I got him. It was really tough because without a full range of shots he couldnâ€™t go anywhere besides our yard. She/He will need to be worn out somehow and itâ€™s tough because they also get bored easy. Youâ€™ll start figuring out what works for him/her. 

Socialization is super important at the ages between 10-16 weeks so be sure to take your pup places and carry him or put him in a shopping cart at dog friendly stores Loweâ€™s and Home Goods are two!) Just avoid dog centric places until heâ€™s had all shots. 

Aussies tend to be shy and one person dogs although they can love whole families. 

Crate Training is super important because Iâ€™ve noticed he doesnâ€™t know how to relax unless heâ€™s in his crate. Make it a fun place (personally I got a large one) and have him go in for treats.

I started basic training immediately for mental stimulation, itâ€™s really important to teach them to be calm and teach them when itâ€™s inappropriate for bursts of energy. I had to teach my puppy to sit and wait for his food because when we first got him he would try and jump and snatch it because he got so excited. Through teaching him to wait heâ€™s actually learned that in most situations when Iâ€™m going to do something with him or give him something, he knows to sit and contain his excitement. 

Aussies donâ€™t do well with negative reinforcement so most of the time yelling, â€œNo!â€ Will cause more energy and frustration from your pup. Iâ€™ve had to learn ways to give positive reinforcement and teach things out of him (making a command for â€œhushâ€ part of our training to teach him not to bark, etc. and rewarding him when he stops barking) Treats are a go to. 

I learned a lot from watching Cesar Milan, Zac George, and Life with Aspen (this last one is specifically about a woman who vlogs her experience with her Aussie and information ranging from Doâ€™s and Donâ€™ts to Grooming videos) on YouTube. 

Good luck!

Iâ€™n glad you mentioned the neutering thing. My vet mentioned it but I was thinking of neutering him around 6 months. Would this affect his growth plates? 

Thatâ€™s reassuring to hear. I work with him fairly often and canâ€™t wait for him to start going to puppy classes! Nipping has been a bit if an issue tho ğŸ˜’ He does get a little rebellious but Iâ€™m thinking it could also be less of an issue with an established routine.
